intro: Ditaxis guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan ditaxis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
